name: Thing
description: The most generic type of item.
title: Thing

fields.name: sameAs
fields.title: sameAs
fields.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

fields.name: image
fields.title: image
fields.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

fields.name: additionalType
fields.title: additionalType
fields.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the 'typeof' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

fields.name: identifier
fields.title: identifier
fields.description: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of Thing, such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See background notes for more details.

fields.name: disambiguatingDescription
fields.title: disambiguatingDescription
fields.description: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

fields.name: dateCreated
fields.title: dateCreated
fields.description: The date on which this item was created.

fields.name: dateModified
fields.title: dateModified
fields.description: The date on which this item was most recently modified.
